database_metadata.name: Comprehensive Dressage Test Database
database_metadata.description: Complete database of USDF and FEI dressage tests including standard tests, freestyle tests, and movement requirements

usdf_standard_tests.description: Standard USDF/USEF dressage tests with prescribed movements

usdf_freestyle_tests.description: USDF freestyle tests with compulsory elements and artistic scoring

external_files.note: Due to file size constraints, detailed test data is organized in separate files

files.description: Introductory and Training Level tests (Tests A, B, C, and Training 1-3)
Second, Third, and Fourth Level tests (9 tests total)
Freestyle tests from Training through Fourth Level

introductory.purpose: Introduce rider and/or horse to dressage, confirming understanding of correct basics

training.description: Confirming correct basics with suppleness and rhythm

introduces.test_1: 20m circles, developing canter, counter canter basics
introduces.test_3: Shallow loops with change of bend, canter-trot transition on diagonal

training.purpose: Confirm correct basics with suppleness, moving freely forward in clear rhythm with steady tempo

first.description: Development of pushing power and lengthening stride

introduces.test_1: Leg-yield, 10m trot circles, lengthening stride, change of lead through trot

first.purpose: Develop pushing power and lengthening of stride; thrust from hindquarters

second.description: Development of collection and medium gaits

introduces.test_1: Collected/medium gaits, shoulder-in, 10m canter circles, rein back
introduces.test_2: Travers, half turn on haunches, simple changes

second.purpose: Horse accepts more weight on hindquarters as collected and medium gaits develop; greater straightness, suppleness, throughness

third.description: Development of extension and flying changes

introduces.test_1: Extended gaits, half-pass (trot and canter), single flying changes
introduces.test_2: Renvers, release of reins at canter
introduces.test_3: Rein back to trot, more complex patterns

third.purpose: Development of extension with increased impulsion; introduction to flying changes and half-pass

fourth.description: Development of pirouettes and tempi changes

introduces.test_1: Collected walk, very collected canter, walk half-pirouettes, multiple single changes
introduces.test_2: Counter change of hand, 4-tempis, working pirouettes

fourth.purpose: Highest level of collection and balance; preparation for FEI levels; pirouette work and tempi changes
fourth.bridge_to_fei: Fourth Level prepares directly for Prix St. Georges with similar movement requirements

key_movements: Half-pass in canter with flying changes
prix_st_georges.introduces: Half pirouettes in canter (3-4 strides), increased frequency of tempi changes, half pirouettes in walk

key_movements: Zigzag: 3 half-passes 5m each side with flying changes
intermediate_1.introduces: FULL pirouettes (6-8 strides), 2-tempis, zigzag pattern. No more half pirouettes in walk

key_movements: Zigzag: 3 half-passes 5m each side in trot
intermediate_2.introduces: PASSAGE and PIAFFE, 1-tempis (every stride changes), medium canter, trot zigzag

grand_prix.introduces: Multiple piaffe sections (12-15 steps), extensive passage work, longer change sequences, complex zigzag, walk to passage transitions

grand_prix_special.description: Most demanding test - Olympic individual medals
key_movements: Half-pass in canter with flying changes
1-tempis (24 times total - 15 on diagonal, 9 on centerline)
grand_prix_special.introduces: Most extensive passage work of all tests, 24 total 1-tempis, walk directly to piaffe transitions, pirouettes on centerline

walk.free_walk: A pace of relaxation where the horse is allowed complete freedom to lower and stretch out the head and neck
walk.medium_walk: A clear, regular, and unconstrained walk with moderate lengthening of stride and frame
walk.collected_walk: The horse remains 'on the bit' with raised neck, shortened stride, and increased engagement
walk.extended_walk: The horse covers as much ground as possible with lengthened stride while maintaining calmness and regularity

trot.working_trot: A pace between collected and medium trot with active, elastic steps and good hock action
trot.collected_trot: The horse remains 'on the bit' with raised neck, engaged hindquarters, shortened stride, and increased cadence
trot.medium_trot: A pace between working and extended trot with moderate lengthening of stride and frame
trot.extended_trot: The horse covers maximum ground with lengthened stride while maintaining balance and rhythm

canter.working_canter: A pace between collected and medium canter with natural balance and steady tempo
canter.collected_canter: The horse remains 'on the bit' with engaged hindquarters, elevated forehand, and shortened stride
canter.medium_canter: A pace between working and extended canter with moderate lengthening of stride and frame
canter.extended_canter: The horse covers maximum ground with lengthened stride while maintaining balance
canter.counter_canter: A suppling movement where horse canters on outside lead
canter.very_collected_canter: Highest degree of collection with maximum engagement, required for pirouettes (Fourth Level+)

lateral_movements.leg_yield: Horse moves forward and sideways with body straight and slight flexion away from direction of movement
lateral_movements.shoulder_in: Horse bent around inside leg, moving on 3 tracks with forehand brought to inside
lateral_movements.travers: Haunches-in; horse bent around inside leg with hindquarters moving on inside track
lateral_movements.renvers: Haunches-out; opposite of travers with hindquarters moving on outside track
lateral_movements.half_pass: Horse moves forward and sideways with body nearly parallel to long side, bent toward direction of movement

special_movements.rein_back: Backward movement in two-time diagonal pairs with straight movement
special_movements.turn_on_haunches: Forehand describes a circle around hindquarters with inside hind leg as pivot
special_movements.half_pirouette_canter: 180-degree turn on haunches in canter (3-4 strides at PSG, smaller at higher levels)
special_movements.pirouette_canter: 360-degree turn on haunches in canter with inside hind as pivot (6-8 strides at FEI)
special_movements.flying_change: Change of lead at canter performed in moment of suspension
special_movements.tempi_changes: Flying changes at regular intervals (every 4th, 3rd, 2nd, or every stride)
special_movements.piaffe: Highly collected trot on the spot or with minimal forward movement
special_movements.passage: Measured, very collected, elevated trot with prolonged suspension

standard_tests.coefficients: Selected movements receive coefficient of 2, multiplying their score
standard_tests.collective_marks: Marks for overall impression in categories like gaits, impulsion, submission, rider position, rider aids

technical_execution.mark_type: Half or full points only (no tenths)
technical_execution.forbidden_movements: 4 points deducted from total for each forbidden movement type

artistic_impression.coefficients_vary: By level - degree of difficulty has higher coefficient at upper levels

freestyle_tests.overtime_penalty: 1 point deducted from Artistic Impression total

usage_notes.for_event_preparation: Use this database to identify exact requirements for each test level when creating competition preparation plans
usage_notes.for_training_planning: Reference movement progressions to understand which skills need development before advancing levels
usage_notes.for_pattern_analysis: Compare rider's current training level to test requirements to identify gaps
usage_notes.coefficient_movements: Pay special attention to movements with coefficients (x2) as they have double impact on score
usage_notes.test_selection: Test 1 of each level introduces core movements; Tests 2-3 add complexity and combinations

usdf_intro_training_tests.json.content: Complete movement-by-movement breakdown of Intro Tests A, B, C and Training Tests 1, 2, 3

usdf_second_third_fourth_tests.json.content: Complete movement-by-movement breakdown of Second, Third, and Fourth Level Tests 1, 2, 3 (9 tests)

usdf_freestyle_tests.json.content: Compulsory elements and artistic criteria for Freestyle tests Training through Fourth Level

fei_test_database_complete.json.content: FEI test requirements from Prix St. Georges through Grand Prix Special
